title: Riot going too far with the suspensions.
body:
Just got a 2 week ban; I've never been chat suspended or anything at all prior to this 2 week ban for... well... you decide what it is. Do you think this chat was inflammatory, toxic, racist or anything else that would cause a 2-week suspension out of the blue without prior chat suspensions or warnings?

Note: Games 1 & 2 were from a few days ago, Game 3 was from yesterday. I've played a total of around 4 games between yesterday and today, when I just received the suspension. It's very odd.

>  I've never been chat suspended or anything at all prior to this 2 week ban

You've had 2 chat restrictions in the last month.

Point out where my chat in these 3 quotes games violated the games' ToS, please.

Announcing reports/asking the enemy team to report something they didn't see EG: Shittalk in teamchat they don't have access to.
Your logs are pretty tame and you almost definitely wouldn't have gotten punished at all if you just avoided announcing your reports or asking the enemy team to report.

Don't forget his harassing of opponents in addition to just the report threats.

Playing nonstandard champs or lanes isn't punishable. He gives up on the game early on just because they have a nonstandard bot lane...

I love playing non-standard champs myself; that's not why the WHOLE TEAM reported him. He purposely fed and lost the game for everyone. I wasn't the only one that reported him; and not because of his champion pick.

And where exactly am I harassing my opponents in that chat log you post?

Don't focus on one game here, because this punishment wasn't about a single game with a troll. I understand that can be frustrating. This punishment was about a consistent theme in your behavior. It's really easy to change. 

The next time someone is doing something you feel they should be reported for, just report them. You don't need to hold your report in front of their face. In fact this will likely make them troll harder. Trolls will get what they deserve, don't go down with them.

Well like I said this whole bannable offense for "asking for reports" thing is news to me; I never got any e-mails or notification from Riot saying "hey everyone we're going to start banning you now if you ask for or tell others they're getting reported".

TL;DR I never got that memo, boss.

> [{quoted}](name=KingDucka,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=GcP6Y3u5,comment-id=0003000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-29T22:43:18.255+0000)

that's not really an excuse, just like killing someone and saying, "i didn't know i wasn't allowed to do that" isn't an excuse. if you don't know if it's allow, you can ask before hand.

It's not ignorance of the "law", but more that a new law was introduced without properly informing the entire community through easily accessible channels (e.g. e-mail) letting everyone know that HEY YOU'RE GOING TO BE BANNED FOR DOING "X" thing. 

In real life when there are new laws passed, it's disseminated so everyone and their grandmother hears about it.
You get the two documents you have to accept to play the same as everyone else. Also not knowing about a new law is still ignorance of the law and still not an acceptable excuse.
ignorance of the law is no excuse?

The Voli was clearly trolling.  OP's only mistake was aggressively accusing him of doing so right at the start of the game, if this chatlog started at the "you're 0-7 in under 15 minutes blah blah blah" this wouldn't be a punish, at all.  His biggest mistake was announcing a report, asking for a report, and not giving the Voli the benefit of the doubt initially.
Clearly trolling based on what? Were you watching the game when it was played?

Picking an off meta champion for a roll and proceeding to practically not get any CS and give a bunch of kills is grounds for reporting for trolling. 
If you are going to pick an offmeta pick, at least try or at least know how to play the champion.  Bot games exist for a reason, don't go into even a normal game and start feeding/not farming

Nonstandard picks and playing poorly aren't reportable in any situation, even when they happen together. There is nothing from these chat logs you can use to determine for sure whether or not he was trolling. 

And trolling or not, there's no reason to call people trolls, harass them over records or mistakes, etc. There's a lot more wrong with this guy's logs than *just* threatening reports.

I REALLY wish Riot would include the whole chat log when telling someone they are banned, suspended, etc. It does not give a full picture and puts EVERYTHING out of context when attempting to re-conciliate and defend oneself against an (in my opinion) unjustifiable ban.

The Voli was in fact, trolling. Sure I don't care about non-standard picks, hell I play them ALL THE TIME. I love my Taric top, and Garen mid. And they work (sometimes).

The problem with -this- player picking Voli was that he didn't even attempt to try to play an off-meta decently, he ran in and fed in the first level 1 and was 0-3 by around level 2. 0-7 around 15 minutes into the game, and then he would run into the jungle camps and died to those, too.

We don't need to know the context in order to see or tell if someone is being a jerk, hence why only the person in question's chat logs are shown. Most people are willing to excuse one or two lines of you defending yourself, but anymore than that and you're just part of the problem. You make the choice to retaliate negatively against someone since you are the one who decides what to type in the chat window and you also make the choice as to when to press Enter to send it as well once you're done. If someone is acting like a jerk even after you've asked them to stop in a respectful manner then just mute them and report them after the game, as they're certainly not gonna stop trolling/being a jerk if you tell them you're reporting them. If you both act up then you both get punished for it, plain and simple.

Now you're just getting into semantics with it. How do you draw the line? Why is it "one to two lines of defense" and no more? How is saying "open mid" bad, when your whole team is agreeing to it? You have no context, you're just cherry picking what you want to deem bad/punishable without having the full picture.

I also never claimed that it was my way or the highway, and if I did give that impression then I apologize. That being said though however, unless you're trying to start a fight here I fail to see what I would have to gain by having that kind of attitude here in this thread.

As I posted below, in Game 1 I asked everyone to report the voli for trolling/feeding because the player picked voli as "adc" -- an off-meta pick which I did not flame him for, but as you see in the logs I did inform the player that as soon as he started feeding he would be reported.

I regularly inform people they are being reported if toxic or trolling/feeding and/or let others know to report someone who is clearly abusing the game such as afk's, feeders, toxic etc. Everyone in game does this; I don't have a single game go by where someone isn't announcing / requesting reports against toxic players, so is this something new now that Riot decided to punish players trying to make the game a safer place by reporting the trolls?

Pretty much.  If someone does something that bad, they will get reported by at least you and your teammates, and if the enemy team have any integrity at all (hint: they won't) they can report as well.  But as soon as you ask them to report you are violating the rules.  
You can not like it all you want, I certainly don't, but it's the rules.  
Your report should be enough by the way.  Some anecdotal evidence from myself, the only time I've ever been punished back when the old tribunal was still up, one of the games in my tribunal case was there because of a single report.

Thank you everyone for your input, whether it was positive or negative regarding my post. So my takeaway from all of this has been:

Don't talk in chat.

If this is what you got from all this, then yes, it will be better for everyone (and safer for you) to not talk in chat.

I have been playing this game for 5 years or so, I have expressed my anger in chat, I have told my teammates I am frustrated with them, I have teased teammates and enemies if they were in the mood. Never have I ever censored myself, and yet all these years I've gotten a Honor ribbon (which I lost at some later point) and the Sportsmanlike Conduct icon.
My secret? During these 5 years I have lost my temper like 5? 10 times? And even then I did not cross the line with my tone and vocabulary, I perhaps called my team "useless" and "incompetent" but that's it.
You're frustrated with your feeding top? You can let them know politely.
"Dude you've died 4 times and you still try to engage and duel... I think you're smart enough to understand that doing that is very stupid. So please stay back, play safe and don't put us in a more difficult position. Just farm if you can, and let us try to carry this."  

Riot *never* said that you can't express things like anger or disappointment in chat. Hell, a friend of mine broke up with his boyfriend and asked his team to not pick on him even if he lost the lane, because he was so upset that he was prone to raging. His team respected that and they even had a toxic player.
You can tell your team you're angry or sad or you just wanna surrender already cause it's a lost cause, you just have to be polite and respectful.

"**OH MY GOD YOU NOOBS FUCK YOU IM AFK THIS IS GG I REPORT U ALL YOU PIECES OF SHIT JUST SURR OR I LEAVE**" <--- No. I'd report you.
"Guys, we're all playing like shit and we're _really_ behind... if we're gonna continue playing this badly we might as well give up. This is pointless, our team is just worse than theirs..." <--- Yes. You're expressing your frustration without insulting everyone around you -- you just lost a game, no need to ruin everyone's day.
